{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3129004,"name":"Gabriel Cobin","username":"Arc-GC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9de0a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-18T17:30:41.208Z","cooked":"

Our team is discussing possible designs for our robot’s system for picking up cones and “cubes”. I’m personally in favor of a 4 bar design and was wondering what some of the pros and cons of 4 bars are.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-18T17:30:41.208Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":701,"reads":329,"readers_count":328,"score":3565.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423717,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-a-4-bar-design","display_username":"Gabriel Cobin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56433,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2855 General Captain"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-a-4-bar-design/423717/1","custom_user_title":"2855 General Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3129008,"name":"Sean Lavery","username":"Lil_Lavery","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lil_lavery/{size}/65226_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-18T17:33:17.783Z","cooked":"

“4 bar design” encompasses a pretty wide variety of designs. Are you able to specify in any more detail what you have in mind?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-18T17:33:17.783Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":329,"readers_count":328,"score":75.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423717,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-a-4-bar-design","display_username":"Sean Lavery","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 1712"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-a-4-bar-design/423717/2","custom_user_title":"FRC 1712","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129009,"name":"Patrick Freivald","username":"pfreivald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pfreivald/{size}/177405_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-18T17:35:56.959Z","cooked":"

A virtual four-bar (or an actual four-bar) are great for keeping mechanisms at the end of a rotating arm at same angle, or are great at tilting mechanisms to specified angles if the vertical bars (or gears/sprockets on the virtual) aren’t the same size.

They are heavier and take up more space than the same arm without the four-bar.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-18T17:35:56.959Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":317,"readers_count":316,"score":73.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423717,"topic_slug":"pros-and-cons-of-a-4-bar-design","display_username":"Patrick Freivald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7547,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Mentor at Large"},"post_url":"/t/pros-and-cons-of-a-4-bar-design/423717/3","custom_user_title":"FRC Mentor at Large","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129031,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-18T18:13:20.620Z","cooked":"

Seems to me that you have to think about the trade-offs inherent in arms this year. A four bar (real or virtual) is good for some things like keeping a consistent orientation to a game piece mechanism. With standard arms of any other type, this requires some other solution. But, you’re trading off other things for this. The big one is likely to be length and the resultant problems of balance and frame perimeter. A telescoping arm can collapse down and solve (at least to some extent) these problems, but a four bar is going to be inherently long and heavy this year to be any real use (unless you’re not going for the top grid row.) So, like many other design choices, you need to think about what you’re doing with it and what you’re giving up to do that.
